com.tigertext.ttandroid.roster

Class RosterManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tigertext.ttandroid.roster.RosterManager

  • public class RosterManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages interactions with the user roster.

      • createGroup

        public void createGroup(@NonNull
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> users,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String orgId,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        CreateGroupListener listener)
        Creates a new group.

      • createGroup

        public void createGroup(@NonNull
                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> users,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String orgId,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.io.File avatar,
                        boolean replayHistory,
                        boolean excludeCreator,
                        CreateGroupListener listener)
        Creates a new group.
        Parameters:
        users - List of user id's to add to the group
        orgId - Organization ID, if null it will default to current org
        name - (Optional) Name of the group
        avatar - (Optional) Binary data to use as the group's avatar
        replayHistory - (Optional) If true, when a new member is added to the group, they will get the messages sent to the group prior. Default is false
        excludeCreator - If true, server will not automatically add the creator to the group. Default is false

                        java.lang.String groupId,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String groupOrgId)
                 throws TTException
        Deletes a group. This is a blocking call. It should not be run on the main thread.
        Parameters:

        groupOrgId - organization id of group to delete
        Throws:
        TTException

      • addEntrySync

        @WorkerThread
public boolean addEntrySync(java.lang.String rosterId,
                                          java.lang.String orgId,
                                          boolean isList)
        Adds a roster entry.

        Note: This method blocks the thread and makes a network call

      • removeEntry

        public void removeEntry(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String rosterId,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String orgId,
                        @NonNull
                        GenericAPICallStatusListener listener)
        Removes a roster entry from the current roster.

        1. Retrieve the roster entry from the DB (so that we can obtain the type). 2. Notify server the roster entry to be removed. 3. Remove roster entry from DB. 4. Publish ROSTER_ENTRY_REMOVED TTPubsubEvent & notify listener on UI thread.

        Parameters:
        rosterId - ID of roster entry to remove
        orgId - Organization ID to remove the entry under

      • removeRosterEntry

        public RosterEntry removeRosterEntry(@NonNull
                                     java.lang.String rosterId,
                                     @NonNull
                                     java.lang.String orgId)
                              throws TTException
        Removes a roster entry from the current roster. This is a blocking call. Do not call on the main thread.

        1. Retrieve the roster entry from the DB (so that we can obtain the type). 2. Notify server the roster entry to be removed. 3. Remove roster entry from DB. 4. Publish ROSTER_ENTRY_REMOVED TTPubsubEvent & notify listener on UI thread.

        Parameters:
        rosterId - ID of roster entry to remove
        orgId - Organization ID to remove the entry under
        Throws:
        TTException

      • leaveGroup

        public void leaveGroup(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String groupId,
                       TTRequestListener callback)
        Removes the user from the group.

        1. Retrieve the group from the DB (so that we can obtain the orgId). 2. Notify server the user to be removed from the group. 3. Remove roster entry from DB. 4. Publish ROSTER_ENTRY_REMOVED TTPubsubEvent & notify listener on UI thread.

        Parameters:
        groupId - ID of roster entry to remove
        callback - the TTRequestListener to callback when the work is completed

      • leaveGroup

        @WorkerThread
public void leaveGroup(@NonNull
                                     java.lang.String groupId)
                              throws TTException
        Takes current logged in user out of a group

        Note: This method blocks the calling thread
        Throws:
        TTException
        See Also:
        leaveGroup(String, TTRequestListener)

      • fetchRosterEntry

        @WorkerThread
public RosterEntry fetchRosterEntry(java.lang.String rosterId,
                                                  java.lang.String rosterOrgId,
                                                  java.lang.String entityType)
        Fetches the roster entry with the corresponding roster id, roster org id, and entity type from the server. Upon success, its inserted into the database. This should not be run on the main thread.
        Returns:
        a roster entry fetched from the server

      • getRoomMembers

        public void getRoomMembers(@NonNull
                           java.lang.String groupId,
                           @NonNull
                           java.lang.String orgId,
                           java.lang.String continuation,
                           GenericActionListener<android.util.Pair<java.util.List<Participant>,java.lang.String>,java.lang.Throwable> listener)

      • getRosterEntry

        @WorkerThread
public RosterEntry getRosterEntry(java.lang.String rosterId,
                                                java.lang.String rosterOrgId,
                                                java.lang.String entityType)
        Checks for the roster entry in the database & returns it if found. Otherwise, fetches the roster entry with the corresponding roster id, roster org id, and entity type from the server.

        Upon success, its inserted into the database. This should not be run on the main thread.

        This method also notifies the server to add this roster entry.

        Returns null if rosterId, rosterOrgId, or entityType are empty or null.

        Returns:
        a roster entry fetched from the server TODO: This should be renamed to getOrFetchRosterEntry

      • getOrFetchRosterEntry

        public void getOrFetchRosterEntry(@NonNull
                                  java.lang.String rosterId,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String orgId,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String entityType,
                                  @NonNull
                                  GenericActionListener<RosterEntry,java.lang.Throwable> listener)

      • updateRostersSync

        public boolean updateRostersSync()
        fetch and update all roster entries and update the DB. Returns true if successful. This is a blocking call and must be called on a background thread.
        Returns:
        true if update was successful

                                  TTRequestListener listener)
        Update the metadata linked to a specific roster Id and org Id asynchronously
        See Also:

      • updateTTMetadata

        @WorkerThread
public int updateTTMetadata(@NonNull
                                          java.lang.String rosterId,
                                          @NonNull
                                          java.lang.String orgId,
                                          @NonNull
                                          org.json.JSONObject ttMetadata)
        Update the metadata linked to a specific roster Id and orgId
        See Also:
        Warning, there is a possible race condition where the other properties in ttMetadata can overwrite other changes saved somewhere else. If possible, please prefer {@link #updateTTMetadataByKey(String, String, JSONObject, Collection)} so that there is no risk of undoing changes to other properties.

      • updateTTMetadataByKey

        @WorkerThread
public boolean updateTTMetadataByKey(@NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String rosterId,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String orgId,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   org.json.JSONObject ttMetadataToAdd,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> keysToRemove)
                                            throws org.json.JSONException
        Update the metadata linked to a specific roster Id and orgId with new data to add, or keys to remove. This is useful so that previous updates won't be overwritten with stale data
        Parameters:
        ttMetadataToAdd - A JSONObject to merge with the existing metadata. Values from the current metadata in the DB will be overwritten.
        keysToRemove - A collection of keys to remove from the existing metadata in the DB.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        See Also:
        To update asyncronously

      • updateTTMetadataByKeyAsync

        public void updateTTMetadataByKeyAsync(@NonNull
                                       java.lang.String rosterId,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String orgId,
                                       @Nullable
                                       org.json.JSONObject ttMetadataToAdd,
                                       @Nullable
                                       java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> keysToRemove,
                                       GenericAPICallStatusListener listener)
        Update the metadata linked to a specific roster Id and org Id asynchronously
        See Also:
        updateTTMetadataByKey(String, String, JSONObject, Collection)
